title: Talking to doctors about evidence and post covid symptoms

last_post.content:
I wrote a small but perhaps in some way helpful thing about talking to doctors about evidence in trying to get post-covid care.

It includes a pdf download of some "cards" I made to help myself & friends who are trying to navigate these difficult, stressful, and time-compressed conversations.

Humans using an LLM to support them created significantly worse code than those without, and at the same time they were *more* confident about their results.

Systemic Dunning-Kruger.

https://lwn.net/Articles/924547/

Thread, long, about Boris Johnson and the UK's COVID19 response.

TLDR is: Johnson is borderline-innumerate to the point of confusing percentages and fractions and got his information from the newspapers. And six months into the pandemic he'd neglected to educate himself about the scientific basics. And a lot of people died as a direct result of his misbegotten policy decisions. https://mas.to/@kityates/109958429104381225

I believe that we won't solve the current AI debates until we take meaning seriously. Unfortunately, neither meaning nor semantics ever makes it in the news, so the general public is badly equipped to judge what is lacking in AI.

Hoping to fill a gap, I am starting a website dedicated to meaning and computation, and directed to general audiences:

https://denotation.io/about/

New content will be posted every month. Please check it out 🙂

#ai #computationallinguistics #nlp #meaning #semantics #llm

title: VOA Puts Two Russian Journalists on Paid Leave Following Complaints

last_post.content:
THREAD: The Voice of America (VOA) recently hired 2 former Russian state propaganda employees. The move was condemned by Ukrainian journalists, who signed an open letter, condemning the employment and calling for their dismissal. The VOA (rightfully) acted, and the two have been suspended.

It's great to see the VOA act so promptly in the interests of Ukrainian audiences, but where is this when it comes to the sensitivity of audiences from the Horn of Africa?

@VOANews

https://www.voanews.com/a/voa-puts-two-russian-journalists-on-paid-leave-following-complaints/6978960.html

This week, Colin Lecher and Maddy Varner published a big investigation into a scoring system that L.A. uses to allocate housing to residents facing homelessness.

We found major racial disparities in the system.

title: A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you

last_post.content:
A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you.

A two-year, €3 million study of seabirds at an offshore wind farm off Scotland combined radar data with cameras to identify the species of seabird and create a three-dimensional image of birds’ flight patterns and how they avoid offshore wind turbines’ rotor blades.

The study’s findings: Not a single collision between a bird and a rotor blade was recorded.

https://electrek.co/2023/03/02/seabirds-and-offshore-wind-turbines-vattenfall/

title: The Micro-Paper: Towards cheaper, citable research ideas and conversations.

last_post.content:
Hello folks! While my latest little project isn't strictly visualization or accessibility related, I wrote a micro-paper on my latest idea: The Micro-Paper! 🎉

I hope that this idea at least gets a conversation going about how research papers are too expensive but (non-archival) social media is to unreliable for disseminating and iterating on little ideas! There has to be a better way that allows us to keep citational integrity but still pursue cheap ideas.

https://www.frank.computer/micro-paper

title: G.O.P. Witnesses, Paid by Trump Ally, Embraced Jan. 6 Conspiracy Theories

last_post.content:
This House investigation into weaponizing investigations has spectacularly blown up in their faces with revelation after revelation that the FBI has a much bigger right-wing bias problem than anyone had previously imagined.

Out today are articles showing that there were FBI agents at the 1/6 insurrection, as well as that Kash Patel did something highly adjacent to paying FBI agents to testify before Congress.

Our second episode of @NulliusInVerba is out! @smritimehta and I talk about skepticism in science. Given that the scientific enterprise is essentially an exercise in organized skepticism, how can we maintain a healthy amount of skepticism while also ensuring that scientists don't slip into cynicism or nihilism?
https://nulliusinverba.podbean.com/e/scepticismus/

PS: Sound quality is a bit lower, but still ok - from next episode on we apply our reproducible data pipeline skills to prevent overwriting raw data ;)

title: The retention problem: Women are going into tech but are also being driven out

last_post.content:
Fascinating @conversationedu article from Vandana Singh at the University of #Tennessee about #WomenInIT:

"Women make up 57% of the overall workforce. Comparatively, women make up only 27% of the workforce in the technology industry. Of the 27% that join the technology industry, more than 50% are likely to quit before the age of 35, and 56% are likely to quit by midcareer."

https://theconversation.com/the-retention-problem-women-are-going-into-tech-but-are-also-being-driven-out-200625

If you are interested, Eric Topol's newsletter has more detailed information about COVID and the ⬆️ risk of heart attack and stroke. He goes through 6 studies.

My take away is that the risk of a heart attack or stroke in an unvaccinated person is *very roughly* ~2x compared to someone who hasn't been infected, & in a vaccinated person who's been infected, it's ~1.4x compared to someone who has not been infected.

I encourage you to read the whole thing!

https://open.substack.com/pub/erictopol/p/heart-attacks-and-strokes-late-after?r=brdl&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=email

#CovidIsNotOver

Things it hadn't occurred to me would be harmed by weakening or repealing #Section230: U.S. food supply safety.

TIL from the "Maintenance Phase" podcast about a food poisoning outbreak caused by The Daily Harvest. It came to light when people nationwide posted to Reddit about being sickened. (Investigations are typically at state level, so different outbreaks' links can be non-obvious.)

Without 230, fear of libel lawsuits would induce Reddit to suppress valuable info.

https://www.maintenancephase.com/

Some #CreativeCoding in #Py5 for the past few days. This started as something else, and gradually morphed into this, mixing various blend modes with a really weak flow field. It is incredibly unoptimized, and takes nearly an hour to generate these, but I do love the results

Code: https://codeberg.org/TomLarrow/creative-coding-experiments/src/branch/main/x_0065
